user.about: My name is Harry Saliba, I am a Software Developer with a focus on cloud based user applications. I am originally from Boston, MA, but spent the majority of my life in Seattle and Bellingham, WA.

blocks.title: Full Stack Developer
blocks.description: Lead technology developer in charge of developing an application stack for processing requests, users and business data.

blocks.title: Computer Science Tutor
blocks.description: Assisted students in completing assignments and understanding computer science topics.

blocks.title: Lead Sailing Instructor
blocks.description: Created curriculum and lead lessons on multiple sailboats and for all ages.

blocks.title: Sailing Instructor
blocks.description: Taught group and private lessons to all ages.

blocks.title: Lead Sailing Instructor
blocks.description: Organized, ran, and lead group lessons for ages 8 - 18.

blocks.title: Assistant Sailing Instructor
blocks.description: Taught group and private lessons on classic wooden boats. Answered phone class and scheduled lessons and charters.

blocks.title: Computer Science BA
blocks.description: Beyond required coursework, completed multiple courses in web design, and mathematics.

blocks.title: US Sailing Small Boat Instructor Level 1
blocks.description: Core instruction concepts such as preparing curriculum, giving presentations, and understanding student comprehension.

blocks.title: Erik Fretheim, PhD
blocks.description: Erik.Fretheim@wwu.edu - Senior project advisor & Director of Cybersecurity Program

blocks.title: Team Captain
blocks.description: Ran meetings, communicated with the university, managed a budget, and created instruction materials during the pandemic.

blocks.title: Club President
blocks.description: Organized group rides, recruited new members, and ran the facebook page.

blocks.title: Team Captain
blocks.description: Scheduled practice, represented the team in the district, recruited new members, and sat in on budget committee.

interests.caption: My senior project was creating a connected device called a Water Weather Station that allows students to crowd source weather data.

interests.imageAlt: Sailing team at the Stanford Sailing Center
interests.caption: As a junior on the WWU Sailing Team I attened an invitational regatta at Stanford. We compeated in a form of racing called Team Racing in which groups of 3 boats work together to win races.
